title: Goldman Sachs raises its first-half 2026 Aluminum Price Forecast and adjusts surplus Outlook
summary: Goldman Sachs raised its London Metal Exchange aluminum price forecast for the first half of 2026 to $3,150 per tonne from $2,575, citing low global inventories, doubts on Indonesian smelter power, and strong demand from EVs and grid expansion. The bank revised its 2026 surplus forecast down to 0.8 million tonnes from 1.1 million but expects prices not to stay above $3,000 long-term due to accelerating supply growth. LME aluminum traded at $3,180 per tonne after hitting a nearly three-year high.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices fluctuated on January 29, 2026, falling to $3,230.50 USD/T (down 1.12%) before rising to $3,306.20 USD/T (up 1.20%), with monthly gains of 8-10% and yearly increases over 26%. On January 28, prices hit 3,296 USD/T, a near 4-year high, up 8.78% in four weeks and 24.6% over 12 months.

title: Aluminum Price Today: China Trading Curbs Stall Rally Amid Supply Constraints
summary: Aluminum trades at $3,159.93 USD, down 0.12% weekly but up 7.16% monthly and 5.70% YTD, near three-year highs amid China's high-frequency trading curbs cooling speculation. Supply disruptions in Iceland, Mozambique, and China's 45-million-ton cap limit downside, with technicals showing consolidation below $3,200 and support at $3,130.

title: [SMM Aluminum Alloy Daily Report] Aluminum prices surged
summary: SHFE aluminum prices surged suddenly on January 28, 2026, with the most-traded continuous contract reaching new levels by 11:30, prompting secondary alloy firms to hike rates amid thin trading conditions.

title: Aluminum starts the year on a bullish note
summary: Aluminum prices have surpassed $3,000 per ton on US and European exchanges due to declining output in China from a government-imposed smelting capacity cap and European production constraints from high electricity prices, leading to reduced global inventories. LME warehouses saw a net decline of over 16,500 metric tons in November 2025. Demand remains robust from construction and renewables, with US recyclers noting a volatile recycled aluminum market influenced by facilities like Novelis in Oswego, New York.

title: January 28, 2026, SHFE aluminum prices experienced a sudden surge - SMM analysis
summary: SHFE aluminum prices surged 4.54% to 25,345 yuan/mt on January 28, 2026, driven by US-Iran geopolitical tensions disrupting aluminum trade and raw material transport, funds shifting from precious to base metals, and expectations of domestic alumina refinery production cuts. Open interest rose by about 68,000 lots, boosting market activity. The report warns of potential price corrections as sentiment cools.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices fluctuated on January 29, 2026, reaching 3,306.20 USD/T amid China's capacity limits at 45 million tons, production disruptions in Iceland, Mozambique, and Australia, and rising demand from the energy transition. Traders worry about global producers' ability to ramp up supply quickly. A weaker US dollar and geopolitical tensions further supported prices, with recent rises hitting over three-year highs due to Chinese supply constraints.

title: Aluminum price hits $3,000 for first time since 2022 on supply concern
summary: Aluminum prices exceeded $3,000 per ton for the first time since 2022, driven by a Chinese smelting capacity cap, European production limits from high electricity costs, and depleting global inventories. Futures rallied 17% in the prior year, with robust demand from construction and renewables. The article notes concurrent gains in other base metals like copper and nickel amid supply issues.

title: Automotive Aluminum Market Analysis Report 2026 - Global Industry Size, Share, Trends, Opportunity and Forecast, 2021-2031
summary: The automotive aluminum market is growing due to electrification trends, fuel economy regulations, and demand for sustainable materials. Electric vehicles use about 30% more aluminum than traditional vehicles to reduce weight and improve efficiency. Innovations include gigacasting technology and recycling over 90% post-consumer scrap for crash management systems.

title: Aluminium and copper rally faces 2026 supply crunch
summary: Aluminum prices have rallied due to production caps, stricter environmental standards, and trade shifts, reaching a three-year high. Demand is supported by electric vehicles, renewable energy, and AI data centers, with expected 40% growth by 2030. Geopolitical changes, including increased Russia-China trade, are influencing supply dynamics.

title: New US Aluminium Smelter: 750K Tonne Facility Opens 2030
summary: A new partnership announced in January 2026 will build a 750,000-tonne US aluminum smelter opening in 2030. The facility incorporates advanced environmental management technologies for sustainable production. This supports transformation in strategic metal manufacturing.

title: Rio Tinto strengthens its global low-carbon aluminium footprint through joint acquisition with Chalco of Votorantim's interest in CBA
summary: Rio Tinto and Chalco have jointly acquired Votorantim's interest in CBA to expand low-carbon aluminum production. This move enhances Rio Tinto's global sustainable aluminum capabilities. The acquisition aligns with efforts to reduce carbon emissions in aluminum manufacturing.

title: HRC Steel Hits 36-week High
summary: HRC Steel increased to 941.00 USD/T, marking its highest level since April 2025. Over the past 4 weeks, Hot-Rolled Coil Steel gained 2.87%, and over the last 12 months, it increased 31.63%.

title: Tariffs, demand boost US steel outlook: Nucor
summary: US steelmaker Nucor expressed a moderately upbeat outlook for 2026 based on demand improvements and continued US tariff protections against steel imports. Nucor entered 2026 with historic order backlogs, up nearly 40% annually in the steel mill segment and up 15% in its steel products segment.

title: Metal Market Update: Steel & Aluminum Prices Heading Into 2026
summary: Steel prices are increasing going into Q1 2026 driven by mill maintenance downtime, the Nippon/US Steel acquisition, tariffs, and coating extras. Lead times are stretching as inventories get refilled, with price increases taking effect in mid to late January.

title: Metal Stocks Plunge on Profit-Taking, Fed Fears
summary: The Nifty Metal index plummeted nearly 5% on January 30, 2026, reversing recent gains as investors booked profits amid Federal Reserve concerns.

title: US Raw Steel Production Rises to 1.78M Net Tons in Late January 2026
summary: U.S. raw steel production increased to 1,778,000 net tons for the week ending January 24, 2026, up 4.6% year-on-year from 1,700,000 net tons and 1.3% week-on-week, with capability utilization at 76.9%. Adjusted year-to-date production through January 24 reached 6,016,000 net tons at 75.9% utilization, a 3.4% rise from last year. Output gains were seen across all major regions, led by the Southern district and Great Lakes.

title: Steelmaking raw material prices increase through January
summary: All but one of the tracked steelmaking raw materials, including coking coal, pig iron, shredded scrap, busheling scrap, zinc, and aluminum, increased in price over the last month, with collective prices up 8% month-on-month. Shredded scrap rose to $420 per gross ton and busheling to $423/gt, 8-14% higher than three months ago. Iron ore fines eased to $106/dmt, down 1% month-on-month, while buyers expect further scrap price increases in February due to weather disruptions.

title: Steel Dynamics Looks to Strong Demand for Aluminum, Steel Operations
summary: Steel Dynamics reports strong demand outlook for its steel and aluminum operations in 2026, with record shipments amid declining imports and improved performance at its Sinton, Texas flat-rolled steel mill. The company plans a $100 million expansion of its biocarbon production facility to raise output from 160,000 to 480,000 tons per year by late 2027, supporting lower-carbon steelmaking. Capital expenditures for 2026 are expected at $600 million, down from $948 million in 2025.

title: Global steel industry battles surplus supply, protectionism
summary: Global steelmaking capacity is set to reach 2.55 billion metric tons by end-2025, with surplus at 680 million mt, as additions in Asia and the Middle East add 109 million mt by 2028. India expects to produce 11.4 million mt more crude steel in 2026, reaching 165.4 million mt, amid efforts toward 300 million mt capacity by 2030. Excess supply pressures prices, with new demand needed, while projects like Hyundai Steel and POSCO's 2.7 million mt/year US plant advance.

title: Copper Outlook 2026: Institutional Rotation, Supply Deficits, Technical Analysis
summary: Copper prices on the LME reached a historical high of $13,238/ton in January 2026, driven by tightening supply-demand balance. J.P. Morgan forecasts a 330,000-ton deficit with prices averaging $12,075/ton, while Citigroup sees potential to exceed $13,000/ton or reach $15,000/ton due to supply shortages. Technical analysis indicates a strong uptrend with prices at $5.83–$5.85/lb and upside targets up to $7.00/lb.

title: Why Record-High Copper Prices Aren't Forecast to Last
summary: Copper prices rallied 22% to a record $13,387/ton on January 6, 2026, due to warehouse withdrawals, AI-related demand, and supply tightness, but Goldman Sachs forecasts a decline to $11,000/ton by year-end. High prices are expected to dampen demand and boost scrap supply, leading to a 300kt global surplus. China's weakened consumption and reduced US stockpiling forecasts contribute to the bearish outlook beyond Q1.

title: Period of elevated copper prices overextended: analysts
summary: LME copper hit records above $13,000/mt in early January 2026 amid supply disruptions and speculation, but analysts like StoneX forecast an average of $11,490/mt for the year, viewing current levels as overextended. Divergent views exist with bullish LME traders versus bearish Chinese positions. China's downstream demand in key sectors is flat or slowing due to high prices.

title: Can Copper Extend Its Gains in 2026? | Presented by CME Group
summary: After 41% gains in 2025, copper rallied above $6/lb on January 6, 2026; key factors include declining ore grades, Trump's tariff policies inflating US premiums, and volatility influenced by Fed policy and China stimulus. Consensus price targets range $5–$6.35/lb amid high volatility over 31%. The video analyzes sustainability of the rally.

title: Copper's momentum: Key catalysts to watch in 2026
summary: Copper reached all-time highs due to supply disruptions and structural deficits driving repricing. The article from Sprott highlights key catalysts to monitor in 2026 for continued momentum. It emphasizes the metal's strong performance amid ongoing market dynamics.

title: Antofagasta touts "compelling" copper outlook amid production increase
summary: Antofagasta highlights a compelling outlook for copper alongside an increase in production. The article discusses positive developments in the company's copper operations.

title: Glencore copper output drops 11% as Rio takeover deadline looms
summary: Glencore's copper production fell 11% in 2026 to 851,600 tonnes, within forecasts, due to lower grades and water constraints at Collahuasi mine. The company projects 810,000 to 870,000 tonnes for 2026, a decline from prior estimates. Long-term plans aim for 1.6 million tonnes by 2035 amid rising copper demand.

title: Copper Price Today, January 30: Why Are Copper Rates Hitting Record Highs
summary: Copper prices reached record highs above $14,000 per ton on January 30, 2026, driven by speculative buying from Chinese funds, weak US dollar, and demand from renewables and electrification. Physical demand remains low with high exchange stocks, potentially leading to corrections. Supply constraints from slow mine development exacerbate price volatility.

title: Copper Shining! Metal's record rally has boosted the fortunes of this ...
summary: Hindustan Copper plans to expand mine capacity from 4 MT to over 12 MT with ₹2,000 crore investment over five to six years, targeting 20% volume growth in FY2026 at over 40% margins. The expansion supports rising copper demand from EVs, renewables, AI data centers, and grid expansion amid a weak US dollar. Production costs are around $5,500 per tonne.

title: Final Cowley assays expand copper system
summary: Final assays from Cowley expand the copper system, as reported in recent exploration updates. The findings indicate potential growth in copper resources at the site.

title: Zijin Joins International Copper Association to Advance Responsible Production and Sustainability
summary: On January 1, 2026, Zijin Mining, the world’s fourth-largest copper producer, joined the International Copper Association (ICA) via its subsidiary Gold Mountains (H.K.) International Mining. This membership underscores Zijin's commitment to responsible copper production, sustainable development, and technological innovation. Zijin aims to collaborate with ICA members to promote innovation, reinforce copper’s role in the energy transition, and build a resilient global supply chain.

title: Autonomous Copper Refining at Olympic Dam: Tech Guide - Olympic Dam's Revolutionary Autonomous Copper Refining Technology Breakthrough
summary: Olympic Dam has introduced a revolutionary autonomous copper refining technology featuring robotic arms for advanced processing. This innovation represents a breakthrough in copper metallurgy and processing technology. The article provides a tech guide on this development published today.

title: FNI unit ships first nickel ore cargo for 2026
summary: Ipilan Nickel Corp., a subsidiary of Global Ferronickel Holdings, Inc., shipped its first nickel ore cargo of 2026, consisting of 53,912 wet metric tons of low-grade nickel ore to China. The company targets production of at least 1.5 million WMT for the year, with a sales mix of 52.6% low-grade and 47.4% medium-grade ore. Mine development includes expanding areas, building haul roads, and installing environmental protections to meet targets while complying with regulations.

title: Solway to restart Guatemala nickel plant after price surge
summary: Swiss-based Solway Investment Group plans to restart its PRONICO nickel plant and CGN mine in Guatemala within months, following a nickel price surge to $19,160 per ton and the lifting of U.S. sanctions. The facility has an annual capacity of 25,000 metric tons of ferronickel, with the mine capable of extracting up to 2.2 million tons of nickel ore. Restart is anticipated around April to May 2026, indicating high prices are enabling resumption of previously curtailed production.

title: Global Ferronickel unit sets 2026 output target
summary: Global Ferronickel announced that its Ipilan unit has commenced 2026 mining operations with the first nickel ore shipment. The company has set specific output targets for the year amid ongoing operations.

title: Nickel Industries cements leadership in ENC, welcomes Sphere as strategic partner
summary: Nickel Industries increased its stake in the ENC project to 46%, becoming the largest shareholder, while Sphere acquired a 10% interest at a US$2.4 billion valuation, reducing cash outflows by US$207 million. The company secured a 15-year MOU for 14 million WMT/year limonite ore supply for the Sampala Project. This strengthens financial flexibility and positions Nickel Industries for battery-grade nickel production as ENC nears commissioning.

title: Nickel Industries completes strategic partner’s entry into ENC project, revises acquisition terms
summary: ASX-listed Nickel Industries completed Sphere's entry into the ENC project and revised acquisition terms. The update enhances project ownership and financial terms for the nickel processor.

title: TECH Project high-grade nickel is primed to fuel the global green transition
summary: Queensland Pacific Metals’ TECH Project aims to become the world’s premier source of high-grade, ethically derived nickel for EV batteries and green energy. The project features the innovative DNi Process, which extracts nickel and cobalt from laterite ore with over 98% nitric acid recycling, no tailings dams, and minimal waste, ensuring sustainability. Once operational, it will be a carbon-negative facility supplying nickel chemicals to the EV and energy storage industries.

title: Nickel Industries cements leadership in ENC, welcomes Sphere as strategic partner
summary: Nickel Industries increases its stake in the ENC project to 46%, becoming the largest shareholder, while welcoming Sphere as a 10% strategic partner at a US$2.4 billion valuation. This deal reduces future cash outflows by US$207 million and secures a 15-year exclusive limonite ore supply MOU for the Sampala Project. The partnership supports transition to battery-grade nickel and cobalt for electric vehicles, enhancing supply chain reliability.

title: Copper Cables: Antitrust Launches Investigation into Alleged Cartel ...
summary: Italy's Antitrust Authority has launched an investigation into major low-voltage copper cable manufacturers, including Prysmian Cavi e Sistemi Italia Srl and others, for alleged price-fixing since 2005. Inspections were conducted yesterday at company offices, distributors, and associations with support from Guardia di Finanza. Prysmian shares dropped 1.26% and Nexans fell 1.9% following the news, though analysts view the impact as negligible given the small market share.
